name: Braiding or multi-thread condition
functionStatement: Examines the role of bank processes and erosion in channel change. Observes patterns in sinuosity and curvature affecting habitat complexity.
descriptionMarkdown: Compares meander migration rates and cutoff frequency to reference behavior; excessive migration or avulsions indicate instability.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Count active threads at observed stage and compare to expected channel type. Use a DEM to corroborate bar and corridor patterns.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Condition aligns with local reference for the stream type.

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Moderate braiding where not typical, or loss of braiding where it is typical.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Heavily braided from instability, or forced single-thread where braiding is expected.
